newsitem.title: USA: Centennial faces new class action.
newsitem.headline: Centennial faces new class action.

text.p: Centennial Technologies Inc on Friday was named in a lawsuit, filed in Massachusetts on behalf of investors who bought the company's stock on February 25, 1997, the plaintiffs' lawyers said.
The complaint alleges Centennial and chief executive Lawrence Ramaekers misrepresented or omitted material information regarding the firm's sales record.
The plaintiffs seek to recover damages from the company and are represented by the law firms of Wolf Haldenstein Adler Freeman & Herz LLP and Berman DeValerio & Pease.

On February 27, the company said it would restate its earnings to show a loss for the last 3-1/2 years rather than a profit. This follows a statement by Ramaekers on February 25 that the company will be an "easy turnaround."
Centennial's shares rallied days prior to the news and surged after the interview.

The New York Stock Exchange halted trading on the company's shares ahead of the announcement about the restated results and subsequently delisted the company, effective prior to Monday, March 3, 1997.
The company already faces at least four other suits seeking to recover damages for similar reasons.
